meanings.definition: The beliefs, practices, or system of the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: Some people study papism to understand the Roman Catholic Church better.
meanings.sent2: Papism has influenced art and culture throughout history.
meanings.sent3: The history class had a lively discussion about papism and its impact.
meanings.sent4: In some ways, papism can be seen as a symbol of tradition and continuity.
meanings.sent5: The architecture of the cathedral reflected the grandeur of papism.

meanings.definition: Excessive reverence for the Pope or the authority of the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: Her papism led her to attend every event hosted by the Pope.
meanings.sent2: The papism of the devout followers was evident in their unwavering loyalty.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him about his papism, calling him the Pope's biggest fan.
meanings.sent4: The papism in her family was so strong that they never missed a Sunday mass.
meanings.sent5: The papism of the community was palpable during the visit of the Papal delegation.
